page.description: PAGECOUNT() returns the number of pages in a report.

section.description: This expression is useful if you want to print a field that shows the current page number and the total number of pages in the report page header or footer. For example, "Page 3 of 10". The Report Layout editor allows you to drag the PageXofY field directly from the Drag-and-Drop list onto the report. However, using the PAGECOUNT() function, you can create your own format.

section.title: Example
section.example: "Page " + alltrim( str(pageno() ,5,0) ) + "of a total of " + alltrim( str(pagecount() , 5, 0) ) + " pages" -> "Page 3 of a total of 20 pages"
